result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Demond Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on Case 13CF4011. Non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of extended supervision on Case 13CF4011. Non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Case 13CF4011. **11-08-16 with nine months of sentence credit for a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may  no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: As to the order signed 11-08-16 amended to reflect nine months of sentence credit for a time served disposition.
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant.  File forwarded to Clerk's office for processing
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Denying Motion for Sentence Credit signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.  Motion held in abeyance pending final resolution of postconviction proceedings in 13CF004011.

Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive with 13CF4011.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on 13CF4011; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of extended survision on 13CF4011; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court adjourns matter for Arraignment and Plea/Sentencing.  Arraignment scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Bobby Demond Baker in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
